RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS IN THEIR LAST THREE STARTS AND HAVE NOT WON A STARTER SINCE STARTING FOR CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARE BACK JACK settled in striking position, pressed the issue at the quarter pole, gained the lead midstretch, and won driving. WHERE'S THE GOLD hurried away, settled outside, roused at the head of the lane, and was along late to earn place. COMMON KNOWLEDGE set a pressured pace from just off the rail, lacked the rally needed when challenged by BARE BACK JACK and gave way late stretch. DAD'S LEGACY pressed the early pace while five wide, angled inside entering the stretch and lacked a closing response. MANFORALLSEASONS away last, chased wide through the backstretch, and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Where's the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: hurried away, settled outside, roused, along 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 9000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $3,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLEVER CONNECTION vied inside early, moved clear in the far turn, was under pressure through the stretch and held firm under handling. WIZARDOFMENLOPARK hurried away then pressed four to five wide in the backstretch, fanned three wide in the far turn, loomed boldly at the head of the stretch but was unable to stall the winner then finished up a clear runner up. BEAUTIFUL CALL chased from the back of the pack, rallied outside of PUNCH PERFECT through the stretch and inched clear for show. PUNCH PERFECT chased inside, rallied with BEAUTIFUL CALL through the drive, and was worn down for third. LANA'S PRETTY GIRL sat in range from the five path, dropped back through the final turn, and yielded. ENEMY LINES contested the pace between rivals, and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: Beautiful Call
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc Dialed In Racing Stable Graham Thoroughbreds and
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, rallied outside, inched clear show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $ 6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BETTIN ON BELLE sat just off the pace outside, moved up alongside SAVYSKYE to contest the lead nearing the quarter pole, moved clear at the head of the stretch and held. REBATE tracked inside, angled out to the four path, made a bid entering the stretch then dug in the final yards and missed. SAVYSKYE saved ground while setting the pace, lacked the rally needed in the drive and weakened. ANNA'S IMAGE raced four wide into the opening turn, chased three wide on the far turn, and faded. WILD RUNNIN MAGGIE reserved off the early pacesetters from the three path, and passed tiring rival into the lane. THIS TIME SWEETIE went five wide into the opening turn, and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Rebate
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, angled 4w, bid, dug in, missed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Peter A. Berglar Racing Interests, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHAKEITFORMEGIRL tracked inside, found seam at the head of the lane then ran to the front and pulled away. STUBBORN LOVE stalked from the rail, pressed the issue nearing the five-sixteenth pole, rallied between, and finished up second best. SASSY CINDERELLA sat just off the pace from the four path, drove five to six wide into the lane, and flattened out late stretch. LILLY'S OF LONDON quickly went to the front, took pressure leaving the backstretch, and came up empty in the drive. FAMOUS LAST WORDS sat midpack, and failed to threaten. SAYGE'S SPIRIT sat in range and was outrun. SASSY MISS ELLIOTT was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Stubborn Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, pressed 5/16pl, rallied between, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Shakeitformegirl
ENTRY.OWNER: Langois Antoine Elliott Madeleine Walper Deanna Poliakiwski Blair and Oxley Sand
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, bid on rail, pulled away

ENTRY.NAME: Lilly's of London
ENTRY.OWNER: Schott Chris Swede Acres Ranch Siwak Daulton and Tallie Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Sassy Cinderella
ENTRY.OWNER: Hurley Racing Stable and Walper, Deanna

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 75. Maiden Special Weight Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NICE GUY EDDIE sent for speed inside, gained an advantage over rivals leaving the backstretch, responded to threats in the final furlong, and drew clear. TAPFERSURE returned to the paddock for a tack adjustment, rated off the early pacesetters, lacked running room inside near the quarter pole, and was outkicked. SIX SHOTS OF T attended the early pace, chased wide in the final turn, and closed late earning show. ADIOS Y GRACIAS vied inside, chased three-wide entering the lane, and was run down in the final strides. LIFES ADVENTURE attended the pace from the four path, drifted out in the final turn, and flattened in the stretch. ALBERTA BERBON offered a late mild bid. TIMELY LIFE never reached contention.

ENTRY.NAME: Adios Y Gracias
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Linda Farr Gale and Edinger Brent

ENTRY.NAME: Tapfersure
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, lacked room inside, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Six Shots of T
ENTRY.COMMENT: attended pace, chased wide, closed late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 10500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3, 500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE CHICAGO squeezed out leaving then saved ground inside, slipped through along the rail at the head of the stretch, grabbed the front at the sixteenth pole and held safely. INDEPENDENCE NEIGH vied outside early, matched strides outside of HIGH KELLY SONG in the final turn, gained a slim advantage but was out finished. SNAP COUNT rated off the pace while four to five wide, chased on the final turn outside, and closed gradually under steady urging. TRICKY SPEEDSTER trailed the field early, closed outside, and flattened in the final sixteenth. HIGH FLYIN TIGER raced wide through the backstretch, and lodged a mild late bid. HIGH KELLY SONG vied inside for the early lead, took pressure through the far turn, was unable to move on with rival, and yielded late stretch. FLYING SUN chased the pacesetters and came up empty in the drive. VICTORY AT LAST chased inside early and gave way late.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Chicago
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed out, saved, bid inside, held safely

ENTRY.NAME: Independence Neigh
ENTRY.OWNER: Dory Bill Dory Sandy Kropp Gary Kropp Janet and Ference Adam

ENTRY.NAME: Snap Count
ENTRY.OWNER: Salt River Holdings Inc and Viking Stables

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 77. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS IN THEIR LAST THREE STARTS AND HAVE NOT WON A STARTER SINCE STARTING FOR CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS OR OPTIONAL CLA IMING $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $16,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISCHIEVOUSOFFICER quickly took command, was given her cue at the quarter pole, and opened up to an easy victory. FLORIST tracked inside through the backstretch, drove between rivals at the head of the stretch, and rallied determinedly inching clear to secure the place finish. ADDYDIDIT trailed the field early, lacked running room at the head of the stretch while in traffic, angled out, missed out on the seam that was taken by FLORIST, found room late stretch, and finished gamely on the wire with DAZZLING MIST for show. DAZZLING MIST rated off the pace while outside, hustled off the final turn, chased through the stretch then flattened out and settled to finish up third at the same time as ADDYDIDIT. QUICK DIAL stalked from the five path, roused at the three-sixteenth pole, and gave way deep stretch. PEARL OF KNOWLEDGE sat just off the pace from along the rail, drifted in at the head of the stretch, and retreated late stretch. JOCKEY OBJECTION- An objection lodged by the rider of ADDYDIDIT against the rider of PEARL OF KNOWLEDGE and FLORIST alleging interference at the top of the stretch was not allowed after review by the Board of Stewards.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Addydidit
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, lacked room, angled out, gamely, DH show

ENTRY.NAME: Pearl of Knowledge
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Juris Jim

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Dial
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 5w, roused, gave way deep stretch

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Dazzling Mist
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside, hustled, chased, flattened, DH show
